result.execSummary:
The defendant William K. Garrett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. William K. Garrett is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • William K. Garrett was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*   Pay DNA surcharge  $250.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney H Edwards.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On State's motion, ct 2 is dismissed.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  PSI waived.  Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 1 year w/conditions concurrent to 13CF772.
